info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 30 at 4:47PM EDT until August 30 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Bulloch County in southeastern Georgia... Candler County in southeastern Georgia... Effingham County in southeastern Georgia... Jenkins County in southeastern Georgia... Screven County in southeastern Georgia... Allendale County in southeastern South Carolina... Hampton County in southeastern South Carolina... Jasper County in southeastern South Carolina... * Until 800 PM EDT. * At 445 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated extremely heavy rainfall associated with Hurricane Idalia. As much as 4 to 6 inches of rain has fallen so far today. The risk for flash flooding will continue to increase as the center of Idalia moves across Southeast Georgia. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Statesboro, Metter, Sylvania, Hampton, Lake Warren State Park, Varnville, Estill, Fairfax, Brooklet, Portal, Brunson, Gifford, Newington, Oliver, Furman, Scotia, Rocky Ford, Luray, Hunters and Captolo. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2-3 INCHES IN 2 HOURS
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
